body:
### Summary

When a package has a preferred version, I'd like to know why it is preferred. Similarly for deprecated versions.


### Rationale

When I want to use a particular version, and Spack tells me otherwise, I need to know whether to trust Spack, or whether to open a PR removing an outdated constraint.

This may also prevent me from going into rabbit holes where others have been before.

### Description

A new (mandatory) field `reason="human-readable string"` would help. A requirement that a comment explains the reason (similar to how the reason for patches need explaining) would also work.

### Additional information

$ spack --version
0.17.1-778-2ab871dd17


### General information

- [X] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Setting `preferred=True` should require a reason
